documents.title: the weekend weather : warm , with sunny intervals
text: a dry and cloudy night , with some clear intervals .
feeling warm and humid for the time of the year , with temperatures only falling to 13c ( 55f ) .
saturday will be mostly dry with a fair amount of cloud , but there should be some bright or sunny intervals .
the moderate sw wind should eventually fall light , and temperatures should reach around 20c ( 68f ) .
another dry day for sunday , with more in the way of sunshine - although high cloud may turn it hazy at times .
temperatures could climb to 24c ( 75f ) .
looking ahead to mnoday - it 's expected to remain largely dry and warm , with sunny spells .
there 's some uncertainty as to when a cold front will push in from the west , bringing the risk of a few showers and cooler air .
author: Julie Reinger
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: police crackdown on illegal motorists
text: a day of action by northamptonshire police has resulted in 28 different offences being recorded in a seven-hour period .
in total seven vehicles were taken off the road , including one that was allegedly using red fuel and pulling a precarious stack of pallets .
other offences included defective tyres , expired mots and driving without insurance .

documents.title: nicholas woodeson nominated for top theatre award
text: the actor nicholas woodeson has been nominated in the uk theatre awards 2017 for best performance in a play for royal & derngate 's made in northampton production of arthur miller 's death of a salesman .

woodeson played the iconic central role of willy loman in the touring production after tim piggott-smith , who was originally cast in the part , died in april , days before the tour was due to begin in northampton .
the northampton performances were postponed and the tour began in cambridge in may .
other nominations in the category are joseph millson for the rover and tanya moodie for trouble in mind .
the winner will be announced at a ceremony in london on sunday .

it 'll be mostly dry , with the chance of a few spots of light rain or drizzle .
it 's very warm for the time of the year , with temperatures peaking at 19c ( 66f ) .
weather has a more localised forecast for you .

documents.title: almost 500 sign petition against restricted use of school building
text: a petition calling for a restriction on the use of a school building in daventry to be lifted has collected nearly 500 signatures .

daventry 's university technical college closed earlier this year and the site has now become the randolph building , which is part of the parker e-act academy - a school which is less than 400 metres away .
the site is owned by the district council , and a lease stipulates it can only be used by pupils over the age of 14 .
protestors say that children aged under 14 are being taught mostly in the old school , despite being so close to the £ 9.4m state-of-the-art building next door .
`` i 've been lobbying my mp , i 've been talking to e-act and i 've been trying to talk to the council , '' said abigail campbell , a parent .
`` out of a sense of frustration that nothing seemed to be happening i 've started a petitition .
`` and i 'm absolutely delighted that 456 people have signed it so far , and it 's going up all the time .
`` when you read the comments of people who have signed it , they share my sense of injustice , but also incredulity . ''
the council says it 'll remove the restriction if the school allows its sports facilities to be used by the general public .
in a statement , simon bowers , business manager at the council , said : `` e-act was well aware of the requirement for 14-19 use back in april 2017 .
`` the council was content with this arrangement .
however it would appear that the message received by parents may have been somewhat different to the position reached by the council , e-act and the education and skills funding agency ( esfa ) .
`` the council remains happy to discuss a way forward with e-act . ''

documents.title: one angel square : official opening for new county council offices
text: northamptonshire county council 's new £ 53m headquarters , one angel square , is due to be officially opened today .
more than 2,000 staff have already moved into one angel square - albeit almost a year later than planned - from 12 council buildings around the county .
council bosses say it will save £ 51m in running costs over the next 30 years .
however , the opening comes at a time when the authority is appealing for fairer funding from central government , with the prospect of £ 500,000 of cuts by 2021 looming if they do n't get it .
cabinet papers due to published on monday are expected to detail wide-ranging cuts and possible job losses .
author: Craig Lewis
BBC Northampton Politics Reporter

documents.title: saints show : david ribbans in the studio
text: on tonight 's edition of the saints show , myself and lennie newman will be joined by south african lock david ribbans .
we 'll hear how he 's adjusting to life in the uk , get his views on how saints have started this season and look ahead to sunday 's european challenge cup match against saracens .
the show gets under way at 18:00 on bbc radio northampton and you can listen online here .
alternatively , from tomorrow morning you can download the saints show podcast from wherever you get your podcasts from .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

busy first day at the european parliament : said i would hit the ground running and had put my first parliamentary questions in within an hour of getting here and launching a new campaign tomorrow .
# rorymep

the expected high is 17c ( 63f ) .

documents.title: northamptonshire 's chamber of commerce celebrates 100th anniversary
text: northamptonshire 's chamber of commerce celebrates its 100th anniversary today .
the organisation is holding its annual general meeting at the guildhall in northampton , the same location where its very first meeting was held exactly a century ago .
the chamber is a member of the nationwide business group , the british chambers of commerce .
tracy brandon from northamptonshire 's chamber said there have been many celebrations .
`` we have had a staff party , we 've had a chamber charity day , we 've highlighted some of our staff who have been with us for a long time , '' she said .
after formal discussions at the meeting , members will be joined by the british chamber of commerce 's director general dr adam marshall .
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: county ins & outs
text: county ins & outs

documents.title: police and crime commissioner launches mental health consultation
text: northamptonshire 's police and crime commissioner says he wants to examine how effective the county 's police and the criminal justice services are in supporting people with mental health issues .

stephen mold says he wants a better understanding of the experience of people with mental illness , attention deficit hyperactivity disorder ( adhd ) and autism , and their interactions with the county 's professional support services .
the time 2 listen consultation coincides with world mental health day .
on # worldmentalhealthday , we 're launching our # time2listen consultation - learn more :
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: waste authority defends change to three-weekly bin collections in daventry
text: daventry district council has defended plans to introduce black bin collections once every three weeks .
the waste is currently collected on a fortnightly basis .
a contract for a new waste collection service for the area was signed this morning .
the scheme is due to be introduced in june .
conservative councillor jo gilford said : `` we went out to the public , we did our research and we came back with this solution .
`` it will hopefully help us improve our recycling and also deliver a service within the financial constraints that all local authorities are facing . ''
dean wetteland from the contractors norse commercial services , says people have got used to the collections in other areas where the system has been introduced .
`` when these systems have come into place , clearly there 's a transition period for people to go through , '' he said .
`` there 's also the worries to start with , but as people go through this they realise the amount of recycling you can fit into the new bins is a lot more than when it was boxes . ''
author: Sarah Jenkins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new mep heading to european parliament
text: former deputy mayor for leicester rory palmer tweets
as i head to @ twitterid for first time as mep i want to say a huge thank you to my predecessor @ twitterid # thankyouglenis # rorymep
hi rory .
did you just replace glenis or was there a vote ?
rory was 2nd on party list at 2014 eu elections ( on members votes ) and so automatically is next in line to replace her .
thanks , toby .
what 's the betting this non-elected mep will now vote against the wishes of the actual electorate ?
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: poultry firm merger consultation begins
text: union leaders have said they 'll try to get assurances about the future of jobs at a chicken processing plant in northamptonshire .
faccenda - which employs about 900 people in brackley and 3,000 nationwide - announced last month it is to merge with another chicken producer called cargill .

a consultation process has begun today and the unite union 's lead national officer for the food sector , joe clarke , said : `` our goal is to get clarity about future job security for our members employed by these two companies .
`` job retention is key for us . ''
faccenda said the new company would have a `` strategy for growth '' .
author: Stuart Bailey
BBC News

documents.title: police appeal over kettering arson
text: police in kettering are urging anyone with information about an arson attack in the town to contact them .
it 's believed a fire at a property in new buildings on meadow road on friday night was started deliberately .
officers say they are particularly keen to speak with a man who was sitting on a bench at the top of meadow road at the time .

documents.title: strictly : reverend richard coles voted out
text: the reverend richard coles has been voted out of the bbc 's strictly come dancing programme .

the vicar of st mary 's church in finedon and his partner diane buswell scored just 14 points from the judges for their paso doble to queen 's flash gordon theme , leaving them bottom of the leader board .
after the viewer vote put them in the dance-off , they lost out to celebrity chef simon rimmer .
`` it 's been a joy from beginning to end , '' the reverend said .
`` every minute of it i 've enjoyed i only forgot to reckon into my strategy that i ca n't actually dance . ''
he said one of his highlights was `` coming together as a group of people '' with the other celebrities and pro dancers and he also paid tribute to the `` fantastic crew '' .
gill barlow , who 's a member of his congregation , said they were very proud of him .
`` he said himself , he 's not a dancer , but he 's an entertainer , '' she said .
`` i just think it 's a dance competition with an entertainment element and he definitely brought that .
`` he had commitment and i thought he showed some improvement . ''
author: Katy Lewis
BBC Local Live
